entry.title: iwa: Fix dangling pointer in IsolatedWebAppInstallerViewImpl
entry.content:
This updates IsolatedWebAppInstallerCoordinator to not synchronously

delete itself when the dialog is closing, which was resulting in the

controller getting deleted before the UI had been destroyed, which

resulted in a dangling raw_ptr for the View's Delegate interface. This

delays destruction so the UI can be destroyed before the controller.



Bug: 1479140

entry.title: [text-spacing-trim] Avoid redundant reshape
entry.content:
When `ShapingLineBreaker` determined to use up to the end of

the given `ShapeResult`, it calls `ShapeToEnd`.



Since r1246256 crrev.com/c/5186201, when it calls `ShapeToEnd`,

the `line_start_result` is already calculated. This patch

changes `ShapeToEnd` to use it instead of re-shaping.



This reduces one re-shaping when `ShapeToEnd`.



This patch has no behavior changes.



Bug: 1463891

Change-Id: I3155e4cf4290657ec87e58c361992e7451f895c7

entry.title: Defer subframe navigations with url-loader in WillStartRequest.
entry.content:
Currently, we only allow the page to be cached if subframe navigations

don't need URL loaders and haven't reached the pending commit stage.

This CL enables the page with has subframe(s) with url-loader

navigation(s) which have not sent network requests if flag is enabled.

This is because after the navigation has sent a network request,

the response might fill the relevant buffer while deferring the

navigation.



Design Doc:https://docs.google.com/document/d/1XLOQuHjCVmBfXAJhgrASkVyrHAK_DGmcYPyrTnOrSPM/edit?usp=sharing&resourcekey=0-uNz75Ux7INdCLhj2FWVILg

entry.title: Support media::VideoFrame with "read_lock_fences_enabled" in WebGPU
entry.content:
WebGPU GPUExternalTexture wraps media::VideoFrame through importExternalTexture() API.

It releases wrapped media::VideoFrame after access finished. However, current logic sets correct sync token but fails to ensure all gpu commands finished.



This CL leverage WebGPU "queue.onSubmittedWorkDone()" mechanism to ensure all gpu commands in current queue finished before releasing the media::VideoFrame to support "read_lock_fences_enabled".



Bug: chromium:1450753

Change-Id: Ifcabc502c7002506611f6a7980a2eb3c8d7b078f

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5194586

Reviewed-by: Austin Eng

Reviewed-by: Corentin Wallez

Reviewed-by: Kai Ninomiya

Commit-Queue: Shaobo Yan

Cr-Commit-Position: refs/heads/main@{#1248596}

entry.title: [OOPIF PDF] Simplify FindFullPagePdfExtensionHost util function
entry.content:
Use WebContents MIME type instead of the presence of

PdfViewerStreamManager to verify whether a full-page PDF is being

hosted by WebContents.



This is a step towards removing the dependency of //chrome in

pdf_frame_util.cc to be able to migrate it to //components and

improve reusability.

Ex: Client implementations like this can be avoided if utils are in

//components - https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:chrome/browser/ui/pdf/chrome_pdf_document_helper_client.cc;l=41;drc=67d90538f11c6b232dbfd716075db52aeb34fd15



This CL also corrects the definition of kPdfMimeType to be inline.



Bug: 1445746

entry.title: ozone/wayland: dnd: get rid of event suppressing logic
entry.content:
Now that DataFetched has been decoupled from Enter callback in

WmDropHandler (see https://crrev.com/c/5187180), it's possible to remove

the event suppressing logic implemented in WaylandDataDragController.

Which simplifies it a lot and eliminates the separate code branches

previously needed to handle the suppressing vs propagating states

throughout most of its functions and callbacks.



Affected ozone unit tests are updated accordingly. Also, in terms of

coverage, this change must be covered by dnd interactive ui tests.



R=sky



Bug: 1487784

Test: Covered by ozone and interactive ui tests.

Change-Id: I46a7aa9ee7c08c6e242703456f1d8b871871db3c

Commit-Queue: Nick Yamane

entry.title: [Files F2] Remove delegatesFocus for <xf-tree>
entry.content:
DelegatesFocus causes some weird issues with scrollbar: when

there's a scrollbar for , if we scroll down and click

the bottom tree item for the first item, the click event has

tree as target instead of tree item.



This CL removes delegatesFocus, and override focus() method to

achieve the same goal: if the tree has a focusedItem_, it will

proxy the focus to that item.



Before: http://go/scrcast/NjEzMTg5MDk1NTIyMzA0MHxhM2M1NzE2MS1lNg

After: http://go/scrcast/NjM2MTc4MjgzNzgzNzgyNHw1NzdhNDAyMy0zNw

entry.title: [Federated] Re-enable faked-ash-interaction tests for LSAN.
entry.content:
See b/299186135 for original thread for original memory leak thread. Note that the original error [1] originated in:



(a) FederatedClientManagerTest::SetUp()



which I believe was incidentally fixed by other CLs. A dangling ptr issue remained for a different test:



(b) FederatedClientManagerFakeAshInteractionTest.



for which a temporary disablement fix [2]was applied.



This CL addresses the dangling ptr issue for (b).





References:



[1] ci.chromium.org/b/8770817034360537025

[2] crrev.com/c/4839482



[3] Testing steps for this CL:



[3a]

`gn args out/dangling` with args:



use_remoteexec = true

enable_backup_ref_ptr_support=false

is_asan=true

is_component_build=false

use_asan_backup_ref_ptr=false

use_asan_unowned_ptr=true

target_os = "chromeos"



[3b]

autoninja -C out/dangling base_unittests



[3c]

autoninja -C out/dangling ash_unittests && ./out/dangling/ash_unittests --gtest_filter="*FederatedClientManagerFakeAsh*" --enable-features=PartitionAllocBackupRefPtr,PartitionAllocDanglingPtr:mode/crash



Test: see [3] above

Bug: b/299186135, b/320559902

Change-Id: Iced0a53053fda165af6ec796044e4932d9daa9b4

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5208970

entry.title: [Android TRM] Inject suggestion tile click handler; bind refresh handler.
entry.content:
Clicking on a suggestion tile on the Tab Resumption Module triggers

navigation, which requires a Tab object. Instead of passing the object

into TRM code, we'd maintain better abstraction by defining a handler,

and inject click behavior as a lambda from NewTabPage.



This CL defines SuggestionClickCallback as the click handler, and adds

the pipeline to specify the handler NewTabPage and pass it to

mayCreateTabResumptionModuleCoordinator() for later use.



In addition, update NewTabPageLayout so that NTP refresh from the menu

also triggers TRM refresh. Note that this EXCLUDES swipe-down refresh,

which has a different flow with other complications.



Bug: 1515325

Change-Id: Idcde9c7ccbb6359512465c8e9c19d1156026fa1a

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5206630

entry.title: Android: Enable __ANDROID_UNAVAILABLE_SYMBOLS_ARE_WEAK__
entry.content:
This simplifies calling functions that are introduced after our

minSdkVersion.



Adds two macros to make availability attributes less verbose:

class REQUIRES_ANDROID_API(x)

is short for:

class __attribute__((__availability__(android, introduced = x)))



#pragma clang attribute push DEFAULT_REQUIRES_ANDROID_API(29)

is short for:

#pragma clang attribute push(__attribute__((__availability__(android, introduced = x))), apply_to = any(enum, enum_constant, field, function, namespace, record, type_alias, variable))



The new warnings (from -Wunguarded-availability) triggered in only two

spots: aaudio_stream_wrapper.cc, and ndk_media_codec_wrapper.cc



This commit converts these two files from explicit dlopen() / dlsym()

to using weak symbols and availability attributes.



See: https://android.googlesource.com/platform/ndk/+/master/docs/BuildSystemMaintainers.md#weak-symbols-for-api-definitions



Bug: 1515372

Change-Id: Ia0a79161456d1cbe1510d840187bf023e62a9be1

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5177627

entry.title: bindings: Improve how to get script_state, execution_context, etc.
entry.content:
* ExecutionContext::From(v8_context) internally runs

ScriptState::From(v8_context) and then get and return the

ExecutionContext discarding the ScriptState. Generated bindings may

use the ScriptState. So,

script_state = ScriptState::From(v8_context);

execution_context = ToExecutionContext(script_state);

should be faster and preferred.



* Except for the case we use v8_context,

v8::Object::GetAlignedPointerFromEmbedderDataInCreationContext is

a faster way to get a ScriptState. So, generally,

script_state = ScriptState::ForRelevantRealm(v8_receiver);

is preferred to

v8_context = v8_receiver->GetCreationContextChecked();

script_state = ScriptState::From(v8_context);

note that ScriptState::ForRelevantRealm internally uses

v8::Object::GetAlignedPointerFromEmbedderDataInCreationContext.



* When receiver_script_state is available,

receiver_context = receiver_script_state->GetContext();

should be the fastest way.



Change-Id: Ifbbe75e0348478a6cd249fdcdbebd2d81b4e6e9d

entry.title: Revert "Fix crash after pressing check button while adding new task"
entry.content:
This reverts commit b0547b2fad0f55612aa2c281b2214bc9ab5d54f1.



Reason for revert: this CL is not 100% correct after merging with Wen-Chien's last CL. Current execution flow is following:

1) OnWindowActivating()

2) UpdateTaskTitleViewForState(TaskTitleViewState::kView)

3) UpdateTaskTitleViewForState calls RemoveAllChildViews()

4) which causes the textbox to lose focus and commit the changes

5) OnFinishedEditing calls task_title_button_->SetEnabled(false),

but `task_title_button_` is yet to be recreated in 3) later.



Original change's description:

> Fix crash after pressing check button while adding new task

>

> This is done via controlling enabled/disabled state of the check button.

> So that pressing it will just commit the title (or remove the whole view

> if the title was empty) as any other click outside.

>

> Also adds control of enabled/disabled state of the `task_title_button_`

> to prevent simultaneous task edits and potential race conditions.

>

> Bug: b/319673528

> Change-Id: I8b17d3992f522dcc7b789ab89f602070c1cd7c3f

> Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5207592

> Commit-Queue: Artsiom Mitrokhin

> Reviewed-by: Toni Barzic

> Cr-Commit-Position: refs/heads/main@{#1248490}



Bug: b/319673528

entry.title: [a11y] Make IsInvisibleOrIgnored=true for invisible descendants
entry.content:
Previously, ViewAXPlatformNodeDelegate::IsInvisibleOrIgnored used

View::visible_ to determine invisibility [1]. However, View::visible_

does not cascade down the view hierarchy, and that behavior is correct*.



That said, some a11y clients (e.g., VoiceOver) allow users to interact

with invisible views if they are in the a11y tree. This CL fixes that by

having ViewAXPlatformNodeDelegate::IsInvisibleOrIgnored use

ax::mojom::State::kInvisible instead to determine invisibility. Unlike

View::visible_, ax::mojom::State::kInvisible cascades down the view

hierarchy.



* Say I have a view v with two children, c1 and c2, where c1 is visible

but c2 is not. If I toggle v's visibility, then I should get back to the

initial state where c1 is visible but c2 is not.



[1]: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/2627320



AX-Relnotes: VoiceOver users will no longer navigate to invisible views.

Change-Id: I13f1e772ef32bbb34066079f718a2469303e2e14

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5186313

Reviewed-by: Dirk Pranke

Reviewed-by: Benjamin Beaudry

Commit-Queue: Chege Gitau

Cr-Commit-Position: refs/heads/main@{#1248532}

entry.title: Remove PushPullFIFO max length restriction
entry.content:
Some discussion was had here, when the maximum value was introduced:

https://codereview.chromium.org/2549093009



But I don't see why it was necessary to define a specific maximum

length at all.



If we are worried about running out of memory we should check the

validity of the created AudioBus. It's possible that we could be

under the max FIFO length and still fail to allocate the AudioBus.



If we're not worried about memory I don't see the use of an arbitrary

maximum length.



So I think we should remove it.



Change-Id: I9cfb02c2cf4719b1d2f94d0b5dbfbddf7953157e

entry.title: Paint controls using Page's color provider
entry.content:
This CL is a follow up on CL:5042390 and CL:5046572, where we plumbed

the page's color providers and added color provider support for tests.

This CL uses the plumbed provider to paint by passing it as an argument

to the NativeTheme Paint function in WebThemeEngineDefault::Paint.



This CL cleans up the previous pipeline which originally saw color

provider instances exist in Blink::WebThemeEngineDefault. This clean up

also saw us change the ExecutePageBroadcastMethod call to

ExecutePageBroadcastMethodForAllPages in

WebContentsImpl::OnColorProviderChanged.



Additionally, this CL moves the logic of determining the color scheme

based on the accent color to the ThemePainterDefault and ensures the

correct color scheme is calculated before painting.

entry.title: [rebaseline-cl] Fix step selection for `{chrome,webdriver}_wpt_tests`
entry.content:
The rebaseline tool attempts to de-dupe build steps that run the same

tests. However, since `{webdriver,chrome}_wpt_tests` are simulated as

plain `linux` ports, their fallback paths are incorrectly identified as

identical to linux `blink_wpt_tests`, of which one is

nondeterministically selected and the others are incorrectly filtered

out.



This change fixes this by simply looking at the step name to determine

uniqueness. Fallback paths are no longer a good indicator of uniqueness

because there are now at least two cases where two suites have the same

fallback, but run disjoint sets of tests. Clean up special logic for

avoiding conflicts between `blink_{web,wpt}_tests`.



Bug: None

Test: git cl patch https://crrev.com/c/5199997/1

Test: ./blink_tool.py rebaseline-cl --no-trigger-jobs --patchset=1

Test: All files downloaded, including `external/wpt/webdriver/`

Change-Id: Ie692c4a44e905a0235b9ee4d0c3b6526d9f841e5

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5207254

entry.title: Move URL Pattern's constructor string parsing logic to liburlpattern
entry.content:
Currently the logic of constructor string parsing of URL Pattern [1] is

implemented in `blink::url_pattern::Parser` which is not accessible from

the network service.



We are planing to use this logic for parsing `match` value of

`Use-As-Dictionary` HTTP response header in the network service for

the CompressionDictionaryTransport feature. This behavior was introduced

in the spec by [2]. And we are planing to use this logic when

features::CompressionDictionaryTransportBackendVersion::kV2 is enabled.



So this CL move the logic in the `blink::url_pattern::Parser` class to

the new `liburlpattern::ConstructorStringParser` class in

third_party/liburlpattern/.



The differences from `blink::url_pattern::Parser` to

`liburlpattern::ConstructorStringParser` are following:



- Use new `liburlpattern::ConstructorStringParser::Result` structure

instead of `blink::URLPatternInit`.

- Use new `liburlpattern::ConstructorStringParser::StringParserOptions`

structure instead of `blink::URLPatternOptions`.

- Use new `liburlpattern::ConstructorStringParser::ComponentType` enum

class instead of `blink::url_pattern::Component::Type`.

- The `Parse()` method receives a callback which handles the logic

of "compute protocol matches a special scheme flag" [3] instead of

compiling the protocol component inside the

Parser::ComputeShouldTreatAsStandardURL() method.



[1]: https://urlpattern.spec.whatwg.org/#constructor-string-parsing

[2]: https://github.com/httpwg/http-extensions/pull/2689

[3]: https://urlpattern.spec.whatwg.org/#compute-protocol-matches-a-special-scheme-flag





Bug: 1413922

Change-Id: I0c5db20302e77820efe6219285b6e9fff5db985e

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5199751

Commit-Queue: Tsuyoshi Horo

MobileOmniboxRefineActionUsage.* actions so that interaction with

entry.title: Add ConcurrentCallbacks and ConcurrentClosures helper classes
entry.content:
This CL adds the ConcurrentCallbacks and ConcurrentClosures helper

classes. These are an alternative to the BarrierCallback and

BarrierClosure helper functions.



Sometimes counting up front the number of callbacks is expensive

and/or brittle. With ConcurrentCallbacks/ConcurrentClosures

you dispense callbacks one by one before calling Done() so it does the

counting automatically rather than the programmer.

entry.title: Fix holding space item count histograms.
entry.content:
Holding space item count histograms were previously non-linear. This

was unintentional and makes it difficult to know exact counts of

holding space items during analysis.



This CL makes item count histograms linear, renaming the existing

histograms to avoid data pollution.



Note that CL also does the following:

* Updates histogram owners

* Revises variant summaries



OBSOLETE_HISTOGRAMS="HoldingSpace.Item.Count.{type}" replaced by "HoldingSpace.Item.VisibleCount.{type}"; "HoldingSpace.Item.TotalCount.{type}" replaced by "HoldingSpace.Item.TotalCountV2.{type}".

entry.title: Files app: Fix race at initialization
entry.content:
The initialization in FileManager.setupCurrentDirectory_() was releasing

the change directory tracker too soon, before finishing the change of

directory.



This was allowing the DirectoryModel.onVolumeInfoListUpdated_() to force

the directory change between setupCurrentDirectory_() and

finishSetupCurrentDirectory_(). onVolumeInfoListUpdated_() already checksi

if there is a directory token active before proceeding.



This CL fixes by releasing the tracker after finishing the change of

directory, aka, finishSetupCurrentDirectory_().



Bug: b:307421951

Change-Id: Ia3cf891971bb02610cc62ef888c91ecc8dcec980

entry.title: [QuickStart] Don't propagate responses after connection is closed.
entry.content:
When a NearbyConnection object is destroyed it will invoke any pending

read callback. This caused a side-effect in Quick Start where we would

report receiving a response after a disconnect. To avoid this we ensure

the Connection is still open before propagating response callbacks.



Test: Verified on Atlas + Pixel 5a

entry.title: [Tab Switcher] Shrink and expand animations for pane entry/exit
entry.content:
Replicate the shrink and expand animations from pre-hub using animator

based animations (no compositor involvement). This is largely based on

the implementation used for the "Grid Tab Switcher Android Animations"

flag, but is modified to work with Hub. There are some gnarly timing

callbacks to get all the layouts to the right state before the animation

runs, but this seems to work with the changes in this CL.



The geometry was fairly straightforward, but the timing and sequencing

here is very complex since we want all the views to be laid out

correctly, but invisible before starting the animation.



Note that like the current animation there seems to be a huge CPU

spike when showing the Hub the first time (this isn't replicatable

after the first time it is shown even after a full cleanup). We may

need to investigate skipping the animation if this continues to

not be resolvable like it was pre-hub.

entry.title: [gtm] Add Edit In Google Tasks button
entry.content:
This cl adds an "Edit In Google Tasks" button under the task view in

edit mode. Clicking the button will opens the Tasks url just like how

the header icon and footer icon work.



This cl also fixes a bug where opening a new browser window in edit

mode will crashes. This is because opening a new window closes the

tray, and the focus manager temporarily saves the current focused view,

which is the textfield in this case. However, the textfield will be

deleted on editing is finished, and thus the focus manager stores a

deleted pointer.

This cl fixes this issue by setting the title to view state before

the browser window is activated. This makes sure that the textfield

is deleted before the focus manager clears the focus.



Bug: b/315189263, b/319673498

Change-Id: Ibba327e28467b9ed86177bdc6f02ffa9b93f172d

entry.title: [autopip] Make "allow once" per navigation
entry.content:
If the user selects "allow once" from the allow / block permission

UI, the intended behavior is for it to apply for the duration of

the visit to the site. The current behavior, however, is to allow

PiP for just the duration of this single window; the next attempt

to auto-pip will ask again.



This CL modifies the behavior to persist until the user navigates

away from the site or reloads it.

entry.title: Fix the broken tests when AppStorage is enabled(Part 25).
entry.content:
When the kAppServiceStorage flag is enabled, AppService blocks the

app publishers creating until it's ready, after reading from the

AppStorage file. This affects some tests, e.g.

NetworkConfigurationUpdaterAshTest.*. Those tests crash because no

data path for the profile:

Received signal 11 SEGV_MAPERR 000000000017

...

#9 0x7fb71a1fe827 base::FilePath::Append()

#10 0x7fb72e112a6c ash::BrowserContextHelper::GetBrowserContextPathByUserIdHash()

#11 0x556a750dbf21 ash::ProfileHelperImpl::GetUserByProfile()

#12 0x556a750db807 ash::ProfileHelper::IsPrimaryProfile()

#13 0x556a834e83a3 NearbySharingServiceFactory::IsNearbyShareSupportedForBrowserContext()

#14 0x556a8295719c NotificationDisplayServiceImpl::NotificationDisplayServiceImpl()

#15 0x556a82956ce9 std::__Cr::make_unique<>()

...

#19 0x7fb6fcef560c BrowserContextKeyedServiceFactory::GetServiceForBrowserContext()

#20 0x556a82956b52 NotificationDisplayServiceFactory::GetForProfile()

#21 0x556a7305f5be apps::ExtensionAppsChromeOs::Initialize()

#22 0x556a730aa83b apps::PublisherHost::Initialize()

#23 0x556a730aa68c apps::PublisherHost::PublisherHost()



The reason should because of FakeUserManager. Actually the fake user

manager is created in TestingProfile, so we don't need to build a new

one, and we can get the user manager directly with:

user_manager::UserManager::Get()



Modify the test setup process to get the user manager directly, and

remove `user_manager_` in the test code, as that has been moved to

TestProfile.



BUG=1385932, b:307623506

entry.title: Fix mini player hide animation
entry.content:
There is a bug in browser controls animation code that causes the

bottom controls height to skip its animation and jump to the end when

the target height is 0. This causes the mini player to disappear abruptly

unless the bottom tab strip is also showing (making the target height

non-zero).



The root issue is proving complicated to fix. This CL is not an ideal

solution but is worth landing for MVP since most users would not see the

working animation otherwise.

entry.title: [cpesuggest] Added CPE Tag for third_party/android_protobuf/README.chromium.
entry.content:
To verify the correctness of the suggested CPE Prefix please follow the steps below

1. Please visit the National Vulnerability Database (NVD) page for concerned CPE Prefix here: https://nvd.nist.gov/products/cpe/search/results?namingFormat=2.2&keyword=cpe:/a:protobuf:protobuf&status=FINAL%2CDEPRECATED

2. The URL has a link to the open source project. Please verify if the third-party dependency for which the CPE Prefix is suggested matches this open source project.

3. If the open source project matches and the CPE prefix is not deprecated, please Code-Review+1 and auto-submit if you have enough votes.

4. If the open source project does not match or if the CPE prefix is deprecated, please follow the steps below to add the dependency to the list of CPE suggestions to be ignored.



Add the incorrect CPE Suggestions to the file go/ignored_cpes_textproto and the reason why the suggestion is incorrect.



Adding CPE fixes to a README.chromium file is recommended practice [1] to enable automated vulnerability monitoring. For more information on how CPE prefixes are used see the Chromium Third Party docs [2].



[1] https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src.git/+/master/third_party/README.chromium.template



[2] https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/HEAD/docs/adding_to_third_party.md#add-a-readme_chromium

entry.title: [CodeHealth] Triage UnsafeDangling in ash::ShelfView
entry.content:
ShelfView::ShowMenu passes in a View* to an async callback

ShelfView::OnMenuClosed. ShelfView::OnMenuClosed doesn't dereference the

View* unless the View is among the ShelfView's child views. If the View

were destroyed, it wouldn't be found among the ShelfView's child views

and therefore wouldn't be dereferenced, so there's no UAF there right

now.

entry.title: Retrieve InputEvent from initiator_frame_host AttributionHost
entry.content:
`DidStartNavigation` might be called in the target frame. The input

event that led to a navigation is tracked by the `AttributionHost` set

alongside the initiator frame. We therefore need to retrieve the

`AttributionHost` associated with the `initiator_frame_host` instead of

using the tracker on `this`.



This CL also moves this logic to the `AttributionSuitableContext`, to

avoid the ambiguity and simplify its usage.

entry.title: Fix color of Hub toolbar tab count icon.
entry.content:
The TabSwitcherDrawable is constructed to watch for tint changes in

its base class TintedDrawable. However plain Drawable has two other

tint methods:

* setTint(int)

* setTIntList(ColorStateList)



This is particularly tricky, because depending on the api level,

support libraries will call into different paths. The current code

seems to be assuming its bespoke TintedDrawable is the only game in

town, which is definitely not the case anymore, really api 21+.



This change tries to fix this class of problem by updating the paint

instead in setColorFilter(ColorFilter), which all paths currently

share. The other approach would be to do this on every draw frame, but

that is likely less efficient.



Bug: 1507839

Change-Id: I61a63e6a5a4c99b338d503f5d6109d42c83b16c1

entry.title: tote tour: Add first interaction preference
entry.content:
Adds a preference to track when an interaction first takes place after

showing the holding space wallpaper nudge. This is measured from first

session start.



This will enable submitting metrics about the impact the nudge has on

users' usage of the holding space.



This also, in the process of moving eligibility checks, fixes a bug

where user newness would not be stored properly if they user did not

perform a drag operating on first session.
